awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences:  Symplectic Topology and Its         Applications
awd_abstract_narration: The problems to be studied are among the kernel problems of                symplectic topology.  The topics include:                                            Classification of contact structures and, especially,                      fillable contact structures on 3-manifolds; influence of the                    topology of a pseudoconvex (or contact type) boundary on the                    topology of a complex (or symplectic) manifold; classification of               Legendrian knots; definition and study of capacity-like                         symplectic invariants for contact manifolds; Smale-type theory                  for plurisubharmonic functions; metrical properties of the                      symplectomorphism group; developing the technique of filling by                 holomorphic discs and its applications.                                              It is important that these problems are at the frontier of                 several complex variables and symplectic geometry, so both fields               will benefit from progress in this direction.  Profound                         connections to mathematical physics also lie in these areas of                  analysis and geometry.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
